maml:description.maml:para: Find function calls with context (parent function, arguments, line numbers)
Extracts all function calls from source code with full context information. Similar to Chandra POSIX analysis pattern. Returns function name, location, parent function, arguments, and source line.
Programming language
Source code to analyze
Optional filter - only return calls to these functions
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Programming language
Path to source file to analyze
Optional filter - only return calls to these functions
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Programming language
Source code to analyze
Path to source file to analyze
Optional filter - only return calls to these functions
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: Returns objects with: - function: function name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Find-FunctionCalls -Language c -FilePath main.c Find all function calls in C file

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Find-FunctionCalls -Language c -FilePath main.c -FunctionNames @('printf', 'malloc', 'free') Find only POSIX memory/IO functions

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Find-FunctionCalls -Language python -Code 'import os; os.path.join("a", "b")' Find function calls in Python code

maml:description.maml:para: Parse include directives from C/C++ files
Extracts #include directives and categorizes them as system, local, or POSIX headers. Based on Chandra include dependency analysis pattern.
Path to C/C++ source or header file
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Source code to analyze
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Path to C/C++ source or header file
Source code to analyze
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: Returns object with: - system: array of system includes (from <header.h>)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-IncludeDependencies -FilePath main.c Parse includes from C file

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-IncludeDependencies -FilePath header.h | Select-Object -ExpandProperty posix Get only POSIX headers

maml:description.maml:para: Send parse or query commands to streaming parser session
Sends JSON commands to a running streaming parser process and returns parsed results. Supports pipeline input for batch processing multiple files efficiently.
Available commands: - parse: Parse file and extract code segments using loraxmod
- query: Parse file and run tree-sitter query
- ping: Check parser health and get stats
Parser session ID from Start-LoraxStreamParser. Default: 'default'
Command type: parse, query, or ping. Default: 'parse'
File path to process. Accepts pipeline input.
Tree-sitter query string (required for 'query' command)
Extraction context object for filtering results
Seconds to wait for parser response. Default: 30
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Parser session ID from Start-LoraxStreamParser. Default: 'default'
Command type: parse, query, or ping. Default: 'parse'
File path to process. Accepts pipeline input.
Tree-sitter query string (required for 'query' command)
Extraction context object for filtering results
Seconds to wait for parser response. Default: 30
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: Parser session must be started with Start-LoraxStreamParser first. Use pipeline for efficient batch processing of multiple files.

Performance: Single session eliminates per-file process spawn overhead. Achieves 40x+ speedup for batch processing vs spawning node per file. Best for processing 100+ files. For exploration, use REPL functions.

maml:description.maml:para: Process files through a streaming Node.js parser using stdin/stdout JSON protocol

Manages lifecycle of a long-running Node.js process that accepts JSON commands via stdin and returns JSON responses via stdout. Optimized for processing large file sets by eliminating per-file process spawn overhead.
Path to Node.js script that implements streaming protocol
Array of file paths to process, or pipeline input
Root directory to make file paths relative to (optional)
Path to save JSON results (optional)
Timeout for each file parse operation (default: 30)
Show progress every N files (default: 50)
Custom command name (default: 'parse')
ScriptBlock to build custom command object. Receives $FilePath, $Index. Default: @{ command = 'parse'; file = $FilePath; request_id = $Index }
ScriptBlock to transform parser response into result object. Receives $Response, $File. Default: returns response as-is
Continue processing if individual files fail
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Path to Node.js script that implements streaming protocol
Array of file paths to process, or pipeline input
Root directory to make file paths relative to (optional)
Path to save JSON results (optional)
Timeout for each file parse operation (default: 30)
Continue processing if individual files fail
Show progress every N files (default: 50)
Custom command name (default: 'parse')
ScriptBlock to build custom command object. Receives $FilePath, $Index. Default: @{ command = 'parse'; file = $FilePath; request_id = $Index }
ScriptBlock to transform parser response into result object. Receives $Response, $File. Default: returns response as-is
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:description.maml:para: Send command to interactive REPL session and read response
Sends JavaScript command to REPL session started with Start-TreeSitterSession -AsProcess. Reads output from REPL stdout.
Session identifier from Start-TreeSitterSession. Default: 'default'
JavaScript command to execute in REPL context
Seconds to wait for response. Default: 5
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Session identifier from Start-TreeSitterSession. Default: 'default'
JavaScript command to execute in REPL context
Seconds to wait for response. Default: 5
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: REPL must be started with -AsProcess switch. Commands execute in async context with lorax, parser, tree, root globals available.

maml:description.maml:para: Initialize a long-running Node.js streaming parser process

Starts a Node.js streaming parser process that accepts JSON commands via stdin and returns JSON responses via stdout. Optimized for batch processing of large file sets by eliminating per-file process spawn overhead (40x+ speedup).
The parser session is stored in memory and can be reused for multiple parse/query operations until explicitly stopped with Stop-LoraxStreamParser.
Unique identifier for this parser session. Use same ID with Invoke-LoraxStreamQuery and Stop-LoraxStreamParser. Default: 'default'
Path to Node.js streaming parser script. Default: bundled streaming_query_parser.js
Seconds to wait for parser initialization. Default: 5
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Unique identifier for this parser session. Use same ID with Invoke-LoraxStreamQuery and Stop-LoraxStreamParser. Default: 'default'
Path to Node.js streaming parser script. Default: bundled streaming_query_parser.js
Seconds to wait for parser initialization. Default: 5
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: Use REPL functions (Start-TreeSitterSession) for interactive exploration. Use streaming functions for high-performance batch processing.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Start-LoraxStreamParser -SessionId 'batch1' # Starts named session for parallel processing

maml:description.maml:para: Start interactive Node.js REPL with tree-sitter loaded
Initializes Node.js REPL session with loraxmod pre-loaded and parser initialized. Sets up global variables: parser, tree, root for immediate navigation.
Two modes: - Terminal mode (default): Blocking interactive REPL for human use
- Process mode (-AsProcess): Returns Process object for programmatic control via stdin
Programming language to parse (c, python, javascript, etc.)
Source code to parse initially
Return Process object with stdin/stdout access for programmatic control. Process must be manually stopped and disposed.
Session identifier for tracking (used with -AsProcess). Default: 'default'
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Programming language to parse (c, python, javascript, etc.)
Path to source file to parse
Return Process object with stdin/stdout access for programmatic control. Process must be manually stopped and disposed.
Session identifier for tracking (used with -AsProcess). Default: 'default'
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Programming language to parse (c, python, javascript, etc.)
Source code to parse initially
Path to source file to parse
Return Process object with stdin/stdout access for programmatic control. Process must be manually stopped and disposed.
Session identifier for tracking (used with -AsProcess). Default: 'default'
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: Terminal mode - type commands interactively: - root.type - Get node type
Process mode - use Process.StandardInput/StandardOutput for automation

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Start-TreeSitterSession -Language c -Code 'int main() { printf("hi"); }' Starts blocking REPL in terminal

maml:description.maml:para: Gracefully shutdown streaming parser session
Sends shutdown command to parser process, retrieves final statistics, and cleans up session resources. Waits for graceful exit or forcibly terminates if timeout exceeded.
Parser session ID to stop. Default: 'default'
Seconds to wait for graceful shutdown. Default: 5
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Parser session ID to stop. Default: 'default'
Seconds to wait for graceful shutdown. Default: 5
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: Always call this function to properly cleanup parser sessions. Returns final statistics including files processed and error count.
Performance: Streaming parser provides 40x+ speedup vs per-file spawning. Use streaming for batch processing (100+ files). Use REPL for exploration.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $stats = Stop-LoraxStreamParser Write-Host "Processed $($stats.FilesProcessed) files in $($stats.DurationSeconds)s" # Capture and display statistics

maml:description.maml:para: Stop REPL session and cleanup resources
Stops REPL process started with Start-TreeSitterSession -AsProcess. Kills process, disposes resources, and removes session from tracker.
Session identifier to stop. Default: 'default'
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Session identifier to stop. Default: 'default'
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: Always stop sessions when done to free resources and cleanup temp files.
